item.title: RARE Obsidian Vault
item.description:
Have no idea how to navigate or use this vault? Click this link to start with the RARE Vault Manual Help Guide
2025-07-25
#⚠️-attention Gym boys booming all day. For the first time in my volunteer time at RARE, I recognized one of the songs, Sweet Carolina, the 11 PM at a wedding version (when everyone has drunk too much).
#⚠️-attention Do not turn the fans in the Barn off!! No notices with this tag in the last week.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/long-term Checked R foot. Starting to see the beginnings of bumblefoot. Gave two textured perches.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Make sure to check PLR when handfeeding.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Will need an exam done by two people
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Only give Metacam on PT days.
- #🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term tPlease clean using the divider.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term See PT schedule.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Please keep an eye on the R foot pad.  There is a spot of concern, possible bumble foot.  Please use perches with astro turf.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term CHECK CHEST WRAP ON 7/26/25.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Wrap looked okay but please look at tomorrow.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term When I arrived he was laying on side of wing that was wrapped.  Please recheck wrap and redo if needed.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term PLR and Menace questionable for both eyes. Please recheck.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Apply tail sheath.
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Start Capstar tomorrow.

item.description:
volunteersDenise, Jennifer Multi column Notice #🦅💥-significant-event 🥳 Released! Rohret Road in Iowa City Finder notified and paperwork filed. Medical These two males were a lot different than the female we released earlier.The female jumped up to the hole and was gone in 2 minutes.This time, the first male jumped up to the hole after 5 minutes.And spent another 20 minutes sitting there until he took off.I waited until an hour, and the other male did not appear.I had a commitment that I needed to attend, and he had not appeared at the hole yet. After I returned at about 4:30, I checked the nest, and he had left.There was an adult male within 100 yards east of the nest and two younger kestrels within 200 yards east of the nest, so I am sure they will have lots of company.   I just came back from a drive while checking on the kestrels.This afternoon on the power lines on Rohret by the hay field where there was one adult and two young kestrels.Tonight there are now one adult and 4 young kestrels.I think this may be working out. (How awesome is that?!  We so appreciate Don’s dedication to AMKEs and all the nest boxes he monitors, including mine!) Multi column Food 0 Medical

Left her a VM with the number for SOAR since they're about 30min away. Becca in Fairfield called about a BDOW that she and a friend found a couple days ago with a wing injury. They tried to take it to a center at Oakland Mills but they don’t do rehab. The BDOW was with her friend in Mt Pleasant, so Kathy went to get the bird today and will bring to clinic tomorrow (thank you, Kathy!!).

🪶 Picked up feathers - 2 LP-ground and walked around volunteers- Young hawk in Davenport.  Photos indicated a fledge, Colin went to check out and could not find the bird. Call about a baby bird in the middle of the road.  Finder was concerned that if she touched it that the parents wouldn’t take care of it.  I assured her she could move it. Baby deer in Iowa City, her dog chased it into a fence and now it was injured.  I told her that it was illegal to rehab deer in Iowa.  I advised her to call the police, sheriff or the DNR. Call from Ashtyn in Cedar Rapids, found a baby red shoulder hawk.  She sent a photo, young coopers hawk, in the photo the baby looked healthy and alert.  They went to get a box and when they came back the baby was gone. Charlis called about 3 baby ducks that she found in downtown IC.  She drove them to our clinic, we were gone.  She then drove to IC Animal Shelter.  They then called us about the babies asking if we could take them. Calls from Tom and Eric - There was an eagle in their yard (Quad Cities), it tried to fly several times and was unable. They said they had been calling people all day and no one was responding.  I called both of them and neither one of them returned my call.  Tamara called me and she said that Eric called her back and they told her the eagle flew off.

item.description:
#🦅💥-significant-event ✨ New Admit
#🦅💥-significant-event 😭 Euthanized No notes found with the specified criteria.Multi column Notice
#🦅💥-significant-event ✨ New Admit Williamsburg Provide supportive care Food Medical
💉Fluids Set up with warm buddy Lethargic Very wobbly Toppled over Multi column Overall Multi column Food Medical
3 mL 💉Fluids in L ing Had trouble giving the fluids even with the small needle, so I’m not sure if I gave the full 3mL Standing in corner of cage when arrived. Very wobbly. Ate well! Put in cage with rolly bed/warm buddy and perch. Standing on rolly bed when we left. Multi column Food 0 Medical
2 mL 💉Fluids Gave rolly bed + warm buddy + perch Closes the R eye sometimes, but not all the time. Tilts head to the right. Does this indicate neurological issues? Multi column Notice
Please make sure to HF him as much as he can eat daily, cut up into tiny bites (and make sure he gets his Clavamox).  Keep in box as opposed to a cage until he is more “with it”. Food Medical
Clavamox Portioned out 10 days (I found a brand new box cutter to be much more precise in cutting the pills, so I left one with the pill stuff) Placed in box with towel and stumps with rest of todays mice. Ate very well at first, then slowed down. Was easier to feed when I put one hand behind his back to steady him. Head very tilty and he is very wobbly. r/o possible ear infection. Multi column Food Medical
Clavamox Fresh towels Head tilt and pretty dull, holding eyes half open. Ate more willingly when Dana stroked top of its head. Multi column Food Medical
Clavamox
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Start on Metacam tomorrow. It seemed to be unstable on a rolly bed because he wouldn’t sit just in the middle of it, so we pushed the rolly bed to one side of the box and put the baby on just the towel on the bottom of the box. This bird was holding his head upside down and sideways. Seems still very wobbly and had trouble eating.
Fell asleep during 🫱 HF. Multi column Food Medical
Clavamox
Metacam PO Head tilt remains prominent. Multi column Food Medical Head hanging but very active eater, then tired out. Multi column Food Medical
Clavamox
Metacam Cleaned box. Very talkative today. Multi column Food Medical Head completely upside down Moving a lot but not vocal. Didn't take not than a couple bites before refusing and passing out Multi column Food Medical Started on gentle PT of head/neck. Please continue daily. Using beak, gently turn head side to side and up/down (as if you’re checking ears). Do all 4 directions (up, down, left, right) 5-10 times. We will hopefully have photos/video to share on exactly how to do it sometime this week, so just do your best in the meantime. this will likely need to be done daily for several weeks and we may see little to no progress for some time. please gently massage head/neck area before and after PT. He will be taken out of the box tomorrow and put in a regular cage. Please do not put back in box. Please keep towel in cage for stability. Multi column Food Medical
Set up on rolly bed with perch option Did head PT, one side had much more range of motion Multi column Food Medical
Metacam PT Multi column Food Medical
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Please hold upright and try to keep head upright when feeding.  Did PT on neck, left right and up and down, 10 each way.  Also did some gentle neck message before and after the PT. Set up on a rolly bed.  Multi column Food 0 Medical
#🦅🩺-bird-care/short-term Please hold upright and try to keep head upright when feeding.  Did PT on neck, left right and up and down, 10 each way.  Also did some gentle neck message before and after the PT. Set up on a rolly bed.  Multi column Food 1 Medical Head/neck PT as described before.

HF until he was very slow to swallow, maybe from stress. Opened L eye twice and R eye once.  Holding his head almost upside down while in cage.   Multi column Food Medical PT I do not see any improvement.
